0.text: How do i find my MAC adress ?

1.text: On which operatin system are you ?

2.text:
/*Open your command prompt*/.
Press on Windows + R, write cmd in the window.
Press Enter to validate.

3.text:
/*Execute ipconfig/*.
In the command prompt, write ipconfig/all, then validate with Enter.
The configuration information of all your network connections should be displayed.

4.text:
/*Search for Physical address*/.
This is the other name for the MAC adress. If you have multiple network devices connected (wireless card, ethernet card), make sure to check which of these media the address in question belongs to.
Assuming you have both on your computer, know that your wireless connection as a different MAC adress than your ethernet connection because it doesn't use the same card.

10.text: Click on the magnifier at the top right of your screen.

12.text: Write the following command : ifconfig and validate with Enter

13.text: Your MAC adress is the one next to the entry titled inet. Multiple adresses could be listed there, in this case, write down on a paper each adress with its corressponding interface.

20.text:
/*Open the commande prompt.*/
Depending on your operating system, it can be called Terminal, Xterm, Shell or simply command prompt.

21.text:
/*Display IP network interface information.*/
On the command line, write ifconfig -a, then validate by pressing Enter.
If access is denied, write sudo ifconfig -a, then enter your password when it is asked.

22.text:
/*Find your MAC adress.*/
Scroll until you find the active network connection (the primary ethernet port is called eth0). Find the entry HWaddr : that's your MAC adress.
